areaDesc.3: Community business center, adequate transportation, close proximity to schools and churches.
areaDesc.4: Steady encroachment of commercial and industrial development along W. Morehead with vacant lots on the south side of this section facing W. Morehead, being retained by developer for sale for commercial establishments.

6.a: Small singles & some duplexes & 4 family apartments

areaDesc.14: On the eastern side of this section is quite a large area devoted to warehouses and commercial establishments, facing on W. Morehead Ave.  It is anticipated that this development will expand Westward on Morehead and lots on the southern side of the area are being held by the developer for sale for commercial purposes.

15.1: Mr. C.W. Nixon, Loan Service Field Representative and personal inspection

areaDesc.3: Adequate transportation, close to schools and churches.
areaDesc.4: Railroad shops, negro section, obsolete properties, oil storage tanks, warehouses located in the area.
areaDesc.14: Area composed of negroes and low-income white people.  The northern part of the area along Hutchison Ave. has very little development.

15.1: Mr. C.W. Nixon, Loan Service Field Representative and personal inspection.

areaDesc.3: No particular favorable influences
areaDesc.4: Lack of adequate transportation, lack of close proximity to schools and churches.  Railroad running through area.
areaDesc.14: The section lying north of the railroad is the most desirable portion.  Homes are built on lots larger than average size.

15.1: Mr. C.W. Nixon, Loan Service Field Representative and personal inspection

areaDesc.3: Area has excellent transportation facilities, close to elementary & Junior High School (around Latta Park), contains churches and community business center.  All vacant lots in that section are owned by one person who has heretofor held prices up.
areaDesc.4: Adjoining area on North (D3) is a negro section of very cheap properties; however, it is hardly likely that Area D3 will ever expand further southward into Area A3.
areaDesc.14: The southern part of this area has long been one of the most desirable residential areas in Charlotte, and land occupancy in this part is approximately 85%.  The northern part of the area around Latta Park is gradually being developed with good, large, substantial single family residences of uniform and modern construction.

15.1: Mr. C.W. Nixon, Loan Service Field Representative, and Personal Inspection

areaDesc.3: Nothing particular
areaDesc.4: No transportation facilties, lack of close proximity to schools, churches, business centers.
areaDesc.14: This area has only a small number of houses in it but they are of better type than the adjoining.  There is one large country home located in the area.

15.1: Mr. C.W. Nixon, Loan Service Field Representative and personal inspection

areaDesc.3: Adequate transportation facilities, adjoins private golf course.  Community business center located on Central Ave. about 4 blocks from this area.
areaDesc.4: Schools not very convenient.  Coal yard and manufacturing plant located on railroad only about 2 blocks from this area.
areaDesc.14: The area consists largely of medium priced single family homes.  Occupied by people of medium income who take pride in homes ownership.

15.1: Mr. C.W. Nixon, Loan Service Field Representative and personal inspection.

areaDesc.3: Western side adjoins negro college, adequate transportation facilities, near white community business center, close to schools and churches.
areaDesc.4: Cemetery adjoining part of area, old type construction, negro population, creek runs through part of area.

6.a: Small cottages and some large singles

areaDesc.14: The western part of area is composed of better class negro properties and eastern part of the area is composed of low-type negro rental properties.

15.1: Mr. C.W. Nixon, Loan Service Field Representative and personal inspection.

areaDesc.3: Close to park
areaDesc.4: At edge of city limits, inadequate transportation, lack of schools and churches, cotton mill community with mill located in area, majority of houses being company owned.
areaDesc.14: This area is a cotton mill village - most all of the population working in the mill and most all properties owned by the mill.

15.1: Mr. C.W. Nixon, Loan Service Field Representative and personal inspection.

areaDesc.3: All city conveniences, communtiy business center
areaDesc.4: Lack of adequate transportation.  Distance to schools.  Distance from main bsuiness district.
areaDesc.14: Tuckaseegee Road running through section connects with one of main highways leading from Charlotte and quite a few filling stations have recently been erected on this road.

15.1: Mr. C.W. Nixon, Loan Service Field Representative and personal inspection.

areaDesc.3: School, churches, near adequate transportation and near community business center.
areaDesc.4: Box factory in this area and most of properties are company owned.
areaDesc.14: There are only a few private owned properties in this section.  About 1931, by reason of mill going broke, these mill houses were open to rent to anyone.  At this time another factory has been opened and the houses are only available for factory employees.

15.1: Mr. C.W. Nixon, Loan Service Field Representative and personal inspection.

areaDesc.3: All city conveniences, paved streets, good transportation faciltiies, school and churches located in district.  Also community business center located in the area.
areaDesc.4: Negro university adjoining section - also box factory.  Adjoining section on north is negro section.
areaDesc.14: The section along Roslyn Ave. & Rozzells Ferry Road has developed since 1926 and contains some nice small singles.  The section east of Rozzels Ferry Road is one of the older sections of the city, with properties medium priced and fairly well maintained.

15.1: Mr. C.W. Nixon, Loan Service Field Representative and personal inspection.

areaDesc.3: Elementary & High School, churches, business center, good transportation facilties.  Older residential section well kept.
areaDesc.4: Creek running through area, adjoining cemetary and negro section.  Close proximity to main business district.

6.a: Large and Small singles, some 4 family apts.

areaDesc.14: As a whole this section is a "High" yellow.  It is one of the older sections with some very nice properties on the north side of Trade St.

15.1: Mr. C.W. Nixon, Loan Service Field Representative

areaDesc.3: Adequate transportation, schools, churches, negro hospital
areaDesc.4: Type of population, cheap construction
areaDesc.14: Major portion of properties in this area all cheap grade of negro houses built for rental purposes.

15.1: Mr. C.W. Nixon, Loan Service Field Representative and personal inspection.

areaDesc.3: Schools and churches located in area, also community business district.  Negro College adjoining area on south.
areaDesc.4: Inadequate transportation for center of area.  Cotton Oil Mill located in eastern part of area.

5.a: Negro skilled mechanics, laborers, domestics, negro teachers

areaDesc.14: The western part of the area is known as "Biddleville" and along Oaklawn Ave. and W. Trade St. are many better grade negro properties occupied by negro professors teaching in the negro college, negro brick masons, and other skilled negro mechanics, but interspersed with these better grade properties are many lower grade properties.

15.1: Mr. C.W. Nixon, Loan Service Field Representative and personal inspection.

areaDesc.3: Close to main business district, schools, & churches.  Adequate transportation facilties.
areaDesc.4: Age of properties - type of construction

6.a: Large two story singles, many apartments

areaDesc.14: This is one of the older sections of the city, with growing tendency to boarding and rooming houses.  Houses are old & obsolete.  There are several large apartments and also several smaller ones.  Close proximity to business district makes good rental demand.

15.1: Mr. C.W. Nixon, Loan Service Field Representative and personal inspection

areaDesc.3: Southern part has bus transportation and elementary school also located in this part.
areaDesc.4: Adjacent to industrial area.  Railroad adjoins northern part on Eastern side, and property along the tracks has tendency toward industrial development.
areaDesc.14: The southern part of this area is "High" yellow.  In the northern part of the area, along Hutchison Ave., there is a tendency towards industrial development and several plants are now located here.

15.1: Mr. C.W. Nixon, Loan Service Field Representative and personal inspection.

areaDesc.3: Has all city conveniences, close to schools and churches and main business district.
areaDesc.4: Old community, cheap construction, type of population.

6.a: Large old type singles and small cottages

areaDesc.14: The great majority of houses in this area all small cheap negro houses, and others are large-type single houses used as boarding and rooming houses in that part of the area adjoining main business district.

15.1: Mr. C.W. Nixon, Loan Service Field Representative and personal inspection

areaDesc.3: Schools and churches, community business center, fair transportation facilities
areaDesc.4: Encroachment of industrial development, cotton mills in area, railroad on west side and adjoining it is Swift Refining Co. and many other warehouses and industrial plants.
areaDesc.14: In portion of area between Charles Ave. & 22nd St. majority of houses owned by cotton mill and rented to operatives.  Northern part of area is the better part, containing larger percentage of home ownership, and can be classed as "High" red.

15.1: Mr. C.W. Nixon, Loan Service Field Representative and personal inspection

areaDesc.3: Adequate transportation for that part located within city limits.  Small community business center located at corner of Plaza and Lola Ave.
areaDesc.4: Majority of streets unpaved - schools, churches not easily accessible.
areaDesc.14: The northeast portion of this area, lying east of Plaza, is a subdivision which has been developed within past ten years, and rates a "High" yellow.  That portion lying southeast of Plaza and adjoining Area B1 is also a "High" yellow benefitting from close proximity to Area B1.  That part west of Plaza and north of Parkway contains the older properties in this section and rates a "low" yellow.

15.1: Mr. C. W. Nixon, Loan Service Field Representative and personal inspection.

areaDesc.3: Construction fairly modern & uniform.  Area close to Country Club.  Transportation facilities adequate on western side of area but not so good on eastern side adjoining area A1 but on this side development is more recent, of good uniform construction.
areaDesc.4: No schools, churches, or community business center in the area.
areaDesc.13: On west side static, on east side static to upward
areaDesc.14: The western side of the section is about 15 years old and when first started it gave evidence of an "A" grade; however, construction of some cheaper houses tended to halt its advance.  On the eastern side there has been quite a large amount of new construction during the past 18 months.

15.1: Mr. C.W. Nixon, Loan Service Field Representative and personal inspection.

areaDesc.3: Adjoins Charlotte Country Club
areaDesc.4: Major portion outside city limits - no transportation facilities

7.3: Nothing ever rented in this area

areaDesc.14: In 1929 there were only about six residences in this section, the majority of which were large estates.  Type of construction and price range would indicate that lack of adequate transportation facilities would not be detrimental.  Area is being slowly developed - with a tendency from the "Estate Class" to the $12,500 to the $25,000 range.

15.1: Mr. C. W. Nixon, Loan Service Field Representative, and Personal Inspection.

areaDesc.3: Has all city conveniences.  Properties adjoining B1 are of fairly good construction.  Elementary school located on Central Avenue.
areaDesc.4: Lack of adequate transportation, property fronting on Central Avenue is low, several small type filling stations and grocery stores combined located on Central Avenue.  Properties are of cheap type of construction on Central Avenue.
areaDesc.14: The northern part of the area is a "High" yellow while that part along Central Avenue is a "low" yellow

15.1: Mr. C.W. Nixon, Loan Service Field Representative and personal inspection

areaDesc.3: Higher type areas on two sides - close proximity to adequate transportation - all city conveniences
areaDesc.4: Railroad running through area.  Coal yard and industrial plant located on railroad.
areaDesc.14: This entire area can be termed a "High" yellow, the railroad running through it and the location in the area of the coal yard and factory keeping it from being a "B" area.

15.1: Mr. C.W. Nixon, Loan Service Field Representative and personal inspection.

areaDesc.3: Senior High School, Elementary School located in the area; also, community business center.  Adjoining Independence Park - all city conveniences - adequate transportation facilities.
areaDesc.4: Adjoining business district, negro sections on two sides, old type of construction.  Boarding and rooming houses - some apartments.
areaDesc.14: On Elizabeth Avenue there are several very nice old type large residences which are gradually being converted into boarding and rooming houses; also, several apartment houses with apartments renting around $40.  The area adjoining Independence Park and B3 might be termed "High" yellow.

15.1: Mr. C.W. Nixon, Loan Service Field Representative and personal inspection.

areaDesc.3: Transportation facilitates adequate churches & schools located in the area, community business center.
areaDesc.4: Railroad tracks running through southwest corner of area.  Cotton mill is located in the area.  Majority of properties in excess of 20 years of age.

5.a: Clerical, mechanics, factory workers and laborers.

areaDesc.14: Area contains a mixture of population type.  Properties are not uniform, containing many small homes and also quite a few larger old type houses.  That part of area adjoining B1 is a "High" yellow.

15.1: Mr. C.W. Nixon, Loan Service Field Representative

areaDesc.3: Adjoining high type area, close to schools and churches and community business center.
areaDesc.4: Entirely negro population.
areaDesc.14: This area is composed of better grade of negro properties, occupied largely by domestics who earn their livlihood in the better areas adjoining.  It is not considered as having a detrimental influence on the adjoining areas.

15.1: Mr. C.W. Nixon, Loan Service Field Representative and personal inspection.

areaDesc.3: Churches, elementary, Junior High & Senior High Schools, park, community business center all located in and adjoining this area.  Good transportation facilities.
areaDesc.4: Nothing particular

6.a: Large & small singles & some 4 family apartments

areaDesc.14: The northern portion of this area consists of older properties while the southern portion contains properties of more recent construction.

15.1: Mr. C.W. Nixon, Loan Service Field Representative and personal inspection

areaDesc.3: Adequate transportation, schools, churches.
areaDesc.4: Cheap properties, negro section almost entirely, and old community.

6.a: Few large singles and small cottages

areaDesc.14: One of the older negro sections of the city - adjoining main business district.

15.1: Mr. C.W. Nixon, Loan Service Field Representative and personal inspection.

areaDesc.3: Adequate transportation, close proximity to schools, churches and community business center.  Substantial type of citizenship.
areaDesc.4: Close proximity to negro area - practically 100% developed.

6.a: Large singles on Morehead - 4 family apts. and small singles on Royal Court & Kent

areaDesc.14: On Morehead Ave. there is located several large expensive homes occupied by fairly wealthy people.  On Royal Court are several 4 family apartments.  The area to the north is occupied by negroes but there is hardly any possibility of an encroachment into this area, B6.

15.1: Mr. C.W. Nixon, Loan Service Field Representative, and personal inspection.

areaDesc.3: Adequate transportation facilities, community business center.  Close proximity to schools and churches.
areaDesc.4: Nothing particular
areaDesc.14: The northern and eastern sides of this area adjoin vacant plots extending down Sugar Creek and on which there is very little likelihood of future development.  The adjoining area (D3) on the North is predominately negro and cheap construction; however, there is little probability of any expansion of this D3 area that will encroach on B4.

15.1: Mr. C.W. Nixon, Loan Service Field Representative, and personal inspection.

areaDesc.3: Adequate transportation, adjoining Latta Park, schools and churches in area.  Also community business center and Post Office Sub-station.
areaDesc.4: Nothing particular

5.a: Executives, business men, clerical, skilled mechanics

areaDesc.14: E. Boulevard is one of older better-class residential streets with many large old-type substantial residences, many of which are still occupied by people of substantial means.

15.1: Mr. C.W. Nixon, Loan Service Field Representative and personal inspection

areaDesc.3: Schools, churches in area, adequate transportation facilties, community business center.
areaDesc.4: City dump and incinerator near southwest corner this area.  Some industrial plants and commercial companies located on Mint St.
areaDesc.14: The center of the area, Kingston Ave. and Park Ave., contains a fairly good substantial type of small singles, fairly uniform and can be termed "High" yellow.  The eastern side of the area is also a "High" yellow.  The part west of Mint St. might be termed "low" yellow.

15.1: Mr. C.W. Nixon, Loan Service Field Representative and personal inspection

areaDesc.3: None
areaDesc.4: Inadequate transportation - at edge of city limits.  City Incinerator and Charlotte Slaughter House located in the area.  Lack of schools, churches, business community centers.  No sewer, lights, or gas.
areaDesc.14: The portion of the area along Sherman Avenue contains a better grade of negro properties but lack of city conveniences has a tendency to keep trend of desirability downward.

15.1: Mr. C.W. Nixon, Loan Service Field Representative and personal inspection.

areaDesc.3: Predominating construction is modern and uniform.  Area has all city conveniences, adjoins Myers Park Golf Club, contains Queen Chicora College, has adequate transportation facilities, contains elementary school, churches representing 3 denominations; also contains community business center.  Area is strongly restricted
areaDesc.4: None
areaDesc.14: Area D4 adjoining on the northwest is a negro section a great many of whom are domestics earning livelihood in Area A2.  The population of area D4 is not increasing and there is no infiltration of negroes into Area A2.  The porperties in the northwestern portion of Area A2 are the older properties in this area, but the predominating are large, substantial homes.

15.1: Mr. C. W. Nixon, Loan Service Field Representative, and Personal Inspection
